definitions.definition: a person who travels into a city to work each day, usually from quite far away

examples.text: The five o’clock train is always packed with commuters.
the **commuter belt** (= the area around a city where people live and from which they travel to work in the city)
A group of regular commuters were playing cards.
About a million commuters use the rail network every day.
Commuter services are under a greater strain than ever before.
Commuters are angry at the increase in rail fares.
Commuters from Essex to London face a nightmare journey today.
I could hear the commuter traffic in the distance.
She lives in a small commuter town, 25 miles from San Francisco.
The accident involved a crowded commuter train.
The developments are in the London commuter belt.
The train was packed with commuters.
The village has become the preserve of rich commuters and second home owners.
There has been an increase in the numbers of daily commuters into London.
There have been improvements to commuter lines.
We need to encourage commuters not to drive into the city.
